channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘We all have economic jitters’: After the Fed cut rates, should my son buy a $600K house?
item.description: “They are tuned in to friends and colleagues, who are losing jobs, cognizant of shifts in company agendas and financial worries.”

item.title: Loss-making Chinese AI chipmaker founded by ex-AMD employees surges eightfold in debut
item.description: At 50 times price to sales, MetaX looks expensive but investor demand focused on China’s determination to build national champions in the tech sector

item.title: Energy stocks are the new bonds, this strategist argues
item.description: In an inflationary setting, why hold bonds at all, says Louis-Vincent Gave

item.title: ‘Am I simply the unloved son?’ My mother ghosted me after my father died. Is she stealing his money?
item.description: “No phone calls, no holiday cards, no explanation, no anything.”

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.
